values.1: Set to 1 to request the CAN controller to enter the initialization mode. After the current activity is completed, the controller enters the initialization mode, and the hardware sets the INAK bit of the register CAN_STATR to 1.
values.0: Set to 0 to request the CAN controller to exit the initialization mode and enter the normal mode, and the hardware clears the INAK bit of the CAN_STATR register to 0.

values.1: Set to 1 to request the CAN controller to enter sleep mode. After the current activity is completed, the controller enters sleep mode. If the AWUM bit is set to 1, the controller clears the SLEEP bit to 0 when a message is received.
values.0: After the software clears to 0, the controller exits the sleep mode.

values.1: The priority is determined by the order in which the requests are sent.
values.0: The priority is determined by the message identifier.

RFLM.name: Receive FIFO message lock mode enable

values.1: When the receiving FIFO overflows, the received mailbox message is not read, and the newly received message is discarded when the mailbox is not released.
values.0: When the receiving FIFO overflows, the received mailbox message is not read out, and when the mailbox is not released, the new received message will overwrite the original message.

NART.name: The automatic packet retransmission function is disabled

values.1: No matter whether the transmission is successful or not, the message can only be sent once.
values.0: The CAN controller keeps retransmitting until the transmission is successful.

values.1: When a message is detected, the hardware automatically wakes up, and the SLEEP and SLAK bits of the register CAN_STATR are automatically cleared to 0.
values.0: Software operation is required to clear the SLEEP bit of the CAN_CTLR register to wake up the CAN controller.

values.1: The hardware detects 11 consecutive implicit bits 128 times and automatically exits the offline state.
values.0: The INRQ bit of the software operation register CAN_CTLR is required to be set to 1 and then cleared to 0. After 11 consecutive implicit bits are detected 128 times, the offline state is exited.

TTCM.name: Whether to allow time trigger mode

values.1: Enable time trigger mode.
values.0: Disable time trigger mode.

TTCM.comment: The time trigger mode is mainly used with the TTCAN protocol.

RESET.name: CAN controller software reset request

values.1: Reset the CAN controller. After reset, the controller enters sleep mode, and then the hardware automatically clears it to 0.
values.0: The CAN controller is in normal state.

RESET.comment: Writing 0 to this bit is invalid.

DBF.name: Debug whether to disable CAN bus from working

values.1: During debugging, the CAN transceiver is prohibited, but the control and read and write operations of the receiving FIFO are normal.
values.0: When debugging, the CAN controller works normally.

values.1: CAN controller is in initialization mode.
values.0: CAN controller is not in initialization mode.

values.1: CAN controller is in sleep mode.
values.0: CAN controller is not in sleep mode.

ERRI.name: Error interrupt
ERRI.comment:
When the ERRIE bit in the CAN_INTENR register is set to 1, an error and status change interrupt is generated.
This bit is set to 1 and cleared to 0 by software, and set to 0 is invalid.

WKUI.name: Wake-up interrupt flag
WKUI.comment:
When the WKUI bit in the CAN_INTENR register is set to 1, if the SOF bit is detected when the CAN controller is in sleep mode, the hardware will set it to 1.
Set to 1 by software to clear to 0, and set to 0 is invalid.

SLAKI.name: Sleep acknowledge interrupt

values.1: When entering sleep mode, an interrupt is generated and the hardware is set to 1.
values.0: When exiting sleep mode, it can be cleared by hardware or by software.

SLAKI.comment: When the SLKIE bit in the CAN_INTENR register is set to 1, write 1 to clear it, and writing 0 is invalid.

values.1: CAN controller is in Tx mode currently.
values.0: CAN controller is not in Tx mode currently.

values.1: CAN controller is in Rx mode currently.
values.0: CAN controller is not in Rx mode currently.

SAMP.name: Level of a receive bit on the CAN controller Rx pin

RX.name: Current actual level of CAN controller Rx pin

RQCP0.name: Tx mailbox 0 request completion flag
RQCP0.comment:
When the send or abort request of Tx mailbox 0 is completed, this bit is automatically set to 1.
Set to 1 by software to clear, software write 0 is invalid.

TXOK0.name: Tx mailbox 0 transmit OK

values.1: The last transmission was successful.
values.0: The last transmission failed.

TXOK0.comment: Set to 1 by software to clear, software write 0 is invalid.

ALST0.name: Tx mailbox 0 arbitration failure flag
ALST0.comment:
When Tx mailbox 0 has a low arbitration priority and fails to send, this bit is automatically set to 1.
Set to 1 by software to clear, software write 0 is invalid.

TERR0.name: Tx mailbox 0 transmit error
TERR0.comment:
When Tx mailbox 0 fails, this bit is automatically set to 1.
Set to 1 by software to clear, software write 0 is invalid.

ABRQ0.name: Send a send abort request for mailbox 0
ABRQ0.comment: Set to 1 by software to abort the sending request of mailbox 0, and reset to 0 by hardware when the sent message is cleared. Software write 0 is invalid.

RQCP1.name: Tx mailbox 1 request completion flag
RQCP1.comment:
This bit is automatically set to 1 when the sending or aborting request of sending mailbox 1 is completed.
Set to 1 by software to clear, software write 0 is invalid.

TXOK1.name: Tx mailbox 1 transmit OK

values.1: The last transmission was successful.
values.0: The last transmission failed.

TXOK1.comment: Set to 1 by software to clear, software write 0 is invalid.

ALST1.name: Tx mailbox 1 arbitration failure flag
ALST1.comment: When the Tx mailbox 1 has a low arbitration priority and fails to send, this bit is automatically set to 1.

TERR1.name: Tx mailbox 1 transmit error
TERR1.comment:
When Tx mailbox 1 fails, this bit is automatically set to 1.
Set to 1 by software to clear, software write 0 is invalid.

ABRQ1.name: Send a send abort request for mailbox 1
ABRQ1.comment: Set to 1 by software to abort the sending request of mailbox 1, and reset to 0 by hardware when the sent message is cleared. Software write 0 is invalid.

RQCP2.name: Tx mailbox 2 request completion flag
RQCP2.comment:
This bit is automatically set to 1 when the sending or aborting request of sending mailbox 2 is completed.
Set to 1 by software to clear, software write 0 is invalid.

TXOK2.name: Tx mailbox 2 transmit OK

values.1: The last transmission was successful.
values.0: The last transmission failed.

TXOK2.comment: Set to 1 by software to clear, software write 0 is invalid.

ALST2.name: Tx mailbox 2 arbitration failure flag
ALST2.comment:
When the Tx mailbox 2 has a low arbitration priority and fails to send, this bit is automatically set to 1.
Set to 1 by software to clear, software write 0 is invalid.

TERR2.name: Tx mailbox 2 transmit error
TERR2.comment:
When Tx mailbox 2 fails, this bit is automatically set to 1.
Set to 1 by software to clear, software write 0 is invalid.

ABRQ2.name: Send a send abort request for mailbox 2
ABRQ2.comment: Set to 1 by software to abort the sending request of mailbox 2. When the sent message is cleared, the hardware clears it to 0. If mailbox 2 is cleared, the software is invalidated by setting 1.

CODE.name: Mailbox code
CODE.comment: When more than one mailbox is empty, it indicates the next empty mailbox number; when all mailboxes are empty, it indicates the mailbox number with the lowest priority.

TME0.name: Empty flag bit for Tx mailbox 0

values.1: No message waiting to be sent by the Tx mailbox 0.
values.0: Tx mailbox 0 has a message waiting to be sent.

TME1.name: Empty flag bit for Tx mailbox 1

values.1: No message waiting to be sent by the Tx mailbox 1.
values.0: Tx mailbox 1 has a message waiting to be sent.

TME2.name: Empty flag bit for Tx mailbox 2

values.1: No message waiting to be sent by the Tx mailbox 2.
values.0: Tx mailbox 2 has a message waiting to be sent.

LOW0.name: Lowest priority flag for Tx mailbox 0

values.1: The priority of Tx mailbox 0 is the lowest.
values.0: The priority of Tx mailbox 0 is not the lowest.

LOW1.name: Lowest priority flag for Tx mailbox 1

values.1: The priority of Tx mailbox 1 is the lowest.
values.0: The priority of Tx mailbox 1 is not the lowest.

LOW2.name: Lowest priority flag for Tx mailbox 2

values.1: Tx mailbox 2 has the lowest priority.
values.0: The priority of Tx mailbox 2 is not the lowest.

RFIFO0.name: CAN2 receive FIFO 0 control and status register

FULL0.name: Receive FIFO 0 full flag
FULL0.comment:
Set by hardware when there are 3 messages in FIFO 0.
This bit needs software to be set to 1 and cleared to 0, and software write 0 is invalid.

FOVR0.name: Receive FIFO 0 overflow flag
FOVR0.comment:
When there are 3 messages in FIFO 0, a new message is received, and the hardware is set to 1.
This bit needs software to be set to 1 and cleared to 0, and software write 0 is invalid.

RFOM0.name: Release FIFO 0 output mailbox
RFOM0.comment: When the software sets this bit to 1, it releases the current mailbox message of the receiving FIFO 0, and automatically clears it to 0 after the release, and software write 0 is invalid.

RFIFO1.name: CAN2 receive FIFO 1 control and status register

FULL1.name: Receive FIFO 1 full flag
FULL1.comment:
Set by hardware when there are 3 messages in FIFO 1.
This bit needs software to be set to 1 and cleared to 0, and software write 0 is invalid.

FOVR1.name: Receive FIFO 1 overflow flag
FOVR1.comment:
When there are 3 messages in FIFO 1, a new message is received, and the hardware is set to 1.
This bit needs software to be set to 1 and cleared to 0, and software write 0 is invalid.

RFOM1.name: Release FIFO 1 output mailbox
RFOM1.comment: When the software sets this bit to 1, it releases the current mailbox message of the receiving FIFO 1, and automatically clears it to 0 after the release, and software write 0 is invalid.

values.1: When the Tx mailbox is empty, an interrupt is generated.
values.0: No interrupt is generated when the Tx mailbox is empty.

FMPIE0.name: Receive FIFO 0 message pending interrupt enable

values.1: When FIFO 0 updates the FMP bit, and it is not 0, trigger FIFO 0 interrupt.
values.0: When FIFO 0 updates the FMP bit, and it is not 0, the FIFO 0 interrupt is not triggered.

values.1: When FIFO 0 is full, trigger FIFO 0 interrupt.
values.0: When FIFO 0 is full, do not trigger FIFO 0 interrupt.

values.1: When FIFO 0 overflows, trigger FIFO 0 interrupt.
values.0: When FIFO 0 overflows, do not trigger FIFO 0 interrupt.

FMPIE1.name: Receive FIFO 1 message pending interrupt enable

values.1: When FIFO 1 updates the FMP bit, and it is not 0, trigger FIFO 1 interrupt.
values.0: When FIFO 1 updates the FMP bit, and it is not 0, the FIFO 1 interrupt is not triggered.

values.1: When FIFO 1 is full, trigger FIFO 1 interrupt.
values.0: When FIFO 1 is full, do not trigger FIFO 1 interrupt.

values.1: When FIFO 1 overflows, trigger FIFO 1 interrupt.
values.0: When FIFO 1 overflows, do not trigger FIFO 1 interrupt.

values.1: When the number of errors reaches the warning threshold, update the ERRI bit to 1, triggering an error interrupt.
values.0: When the number of errors reaches the warning threshold, the ERRI bit will not be updated, and the error interrupt will not be triggered.

values.1: When entering the error passive state, update the ERRI bit to 1, triggering an error interrupt.
values.0: When entering the error passive state, the ERRI bit is not updated and the error interrupt is not triggered.

values.1: When entering the offline state, update the ERRI bit to 1, triggering an error interrupt.
values.0: When entering the offline state, the ERRI bit will not be updated, and the error interrupt will not be triggered.

values.1: When an error is detected, the hardware updates LEC[2:0], updates the ERRI bit to 1, and triggers an error interrupt.
values.0: When an error is detected, the hardware updates LEC[2:0], does not update the ERRI bit, and does not trigger an error interrupt.

values.1: When the CAN controller generates an error, an interrupt is generated.
values.0: No interrupt is generated when the CAN controller generates an error.

values.1: When the CAN controller is woken up, an interrupt is generated.
values.0: No interrupt is generated when the CAN controller wakes up.

values.1: When entering the sleep state, an interrupt is generated.
values.0: No interrupt is generated when entering sleep state.

EWGF.name: Error warning flag bit
EWGF.comment: When the sending and receiving error counter reaches the warning threshold, that is, greater than or equal to 96, the hardware is set to 1.

EPVF.name: Error passive flag
EPVF.comment: When the transceiver error counter reaches the error passive threshold, that is, greater than 127, the hardware is set to 1.

BOFF.name: Bus-off status flag
BOFF.comment: When the CAN controller enters the offline state, the hardware automatically sets it to 1; when it exits the offline state, the hardware automatically clears it to 0.

LEC.name: Last error code
LEC.comment:
When detecting the sending error on the CAN bus, the controller will set according to the error condition, and set 000b when sending and receiving the message correctly.
Usually when the application software reads the error, the code name is set to 111b, and the code name update can be detected.

TEC.name: Transmit error counter
TEC.comment: When the CAN sends an error, according to the error condition, the counter is incremented by 1 or 8; after the transmission is successful, the counter is decremented by 1 or set to 120 (the error count value is greater than 127). When the counter value exceeds 127, the CAN enters the error passive state.

REC.name: Receive error counter
REC.comment: When the CAN receives an error, according to the error condition, the counter is incremented by 1 or 8; after successful reception, the counter is decreased by 1 or set to 120 (the error count value is greater than 127). When the counter value exceeds 127, the CAN enters the error passive state.

BRP.name: Baud rate prescaler
BRP.comment:
The CAN baud rate is calculated by the following formula:
CAN_bps = PCLK1 / ((TS1[3:0] + 1 + TS2[2:0] + 1) * (BRP[9:0] + 1))

TS1.name: Time segment 1
TS1.comment: It defines how many minimum time units are occupied by time period 1, and the actual value is (TS1[3:0] + 1).

TS2.name: Time segment 2
TS2.comment: It defines how many minimum time units are occupied by time period 2, and the actual value is (TS2[2:0] + 1).

SJW.name: Resynchronization jump width
SJW.comment: When implementing resynchronization, the upper limit of the minimum number of time units that can be extended and reduced in the bit, the actual value is (SJW[1:0] + 1), and the range can be set to 1 to 4 minimum time units.

values.1: Enter loopback mode.
values.0: Exit loopback mode.

values.1: Enter silent mode.
values.0: Exit silent mode.

TXRQ.name: Transmit mailbox request
TXRQ.comment: When the software is set to 1, the data in the mailbox is requested to be sent. When the mailbox is empty after sending, the hardware is cleared to 0.

values.1: Remote frame.
values.0: Data frame.

values.1: Extended identifier.
values.0: Standard identifier.

EXID.name: Extended identifier
EXID.comment: The lower 18 bits of the extended identifier.

STID.name: Standard identifier
STID.comment: The upper 11 bits of a standard or extended identifier.

TXMDTR0.name: CAN2 Tx mailbox 0 data length and timestamp register

DLC.name: Data length code
DLC.comment:
Data length of data frame or remote frame request data length.
The data length can be set from 0 to 8.

TGT.name: Transmit global time

values.1: Send timestamp, the value is the immediate value of TIME[15:0], replacing the last 2 bytes of the 8-byte message.
values.0: No timestamp is sent.

TGT.comment: This bit is valid when TTCM is set to 1 and the message length is 8.

TIME.name: Message timestamp
TIME.comment: The 16-bit timer value used to send the message SOF time.

TXMDLR0.name: CAN2 Tx mailbox 0 data low register

DATA0.name: Data byte 0
DATA0.comment: Send the content of data byte 0.

DATA1.name: Data byte 1
DATA1.comment: Send the content of data byte 1.

DATA2.name: Data byte 2
DATA2.comment: Send the content of data byte 2.

DATA3.name: Data byte 3
DATA3.comment: Send the content of data byte 3.

TXMDHR0.name: CAN2 Tx mailbox 0 data high register

DATA4.name: Data byte 4
DATA4.comment: Send the content of data byte 4.

DATA5.name: Data byte 5
DATA5.comment: Send the content of data byte 5.

DATA6.name: Data byte 6
DATA6.comment: Send the content of data byte 6.

DATA7.name: Data byte 7
DATA7.comment: Send the content of data byte 7.

TXRQ.name: Transmit mailbox request
TXRQ.comment: When the software is set to 1, the data in the mailbox is requested to be sent. When the mailbox is empty after sending, the hardware is cleared to 0.

values.1: Remote frame.
values.0: Data frame.

values.1: Extended identifier.
values.0: Standard identifier.

EXID.name: Extended identifier
EXID.comment: The lower 18 bits of the extended identifier.

STID.name: Standard identifier
STID.comment: The upper 11 bits of a standard or extended identifier.

TXMDTR1.name: CAN2 Tx mailbox 1 data length and timestamp register

DLC.comment:
Data length of data frame or remote frame request data length.
The data length can be set from 0 to 8.

TGT.name: Transmit global time

values.1: Send timestamp, the value is the immediate value of TIME[15:0], replacing the last 2 bytes of the 8-byte message.
values.0: No timestamp is sent.

TGT.comment: This bit is valid when TTCM is set to 1 and the message length is 8.

TIME.name: Message timestamp
TIME.comment: The 16-bit timer value used to send the message SOF time.

TXRQ.name: Transmit mailbox request
TXRQ.comment: When the software is set to 1, the data in the mailbox is requested to be sent. When the mailbox is empty after sending, the hardware is cleared to 0.

values.1: Remote frame.
values.0: Data frame.

values.1: Extended identifier.
values.0: Standard identifier.

EXID.name: Extended identifier
EXID.comment: The lower 18 bits of the extended identifier.

STID.name: Standard identifier

TXMDTR2.name: CAN2 Tx mailbox 2 data length and timestamp register

DLC.name: Data length code
DLC.comment:
Data length of data frame or remote frame request data length.
The data length can be set from 0 to 8.

TGT.name: Transmit global time

values.1: Send timestamp, the value is the immediate value of TIME[15:0], replacing the last 2 bytes of the 8-byte message.
values.0: No timestamp is sent.

TGT.comment: This bit is valid when TTCM is set to 1 and the message length is 8.

TIME.name: Message timestamp

TXMDLR2.name: CAN2 Tx mailbox 2 data low register

Received message data length.

Received message data length.

FMI.name: Filter match index

DATA2.name: Data byte 2

values.1: Filter bank is in initialization mode.
values.0: Filter bank is in normal mode.

FBM0.name: Working mode control of filter bank 0

values.0: The register of filter bank 0 is in mask bit mode.
values.1: The register of filter bank 0 is in identifier list mode.

FBM0.comment: Only can be written when FINT is 1.

FBM1.name: Working mode control of filter bank 1

values.0: The register of filter bank 1 is in mask bit mode.
values.1: The register of filter bank 1 is in identifier list mode.

FBM1.comment: Only can be written when FINT is 1.

FBM2.name: Working mode control of filter bank 2

values.0: The register of filter bank 2 is in mask bit mode.
values.1: The register of filter bank 2 is in identifier list mode.

FBM2.comment: Only can be written when FINT is 1.

FBM3.name: Working mode control of filter bank 3

values.0: The register of filter bank 3 is in mask bit mode.
values.1: The register of filter bank 3 is in identifier list mode.

FBM3.comment: Only can be written when FINT is 1.

FBM4.name: Working mode control of filter bank 4

values.0: The register of filter bank 4 is in mask bit mode.
values.1: The register of filter bank 4 is in identifier list mode.

FBM4.comment: Only can be written when FINT is 1.

FBM5.name: Working mode control of filter bank 5

values.0: The register of filter bank 5 is in mask bit mode.
values.1: The register of filter bank 5 is in identifier list mode.

FBM5.comment: Only can be written when FINT is 1.

FBM6.name: Working mode control of filter bank 6

values.0: The register of filter bank 6 is in mask bit mode.
values.1: The register of filter bank 6 is in identifier list mode.

FBM6.comment: Only can be written when FINT is 1.

FBM7.name: Working mode control of filter bank 7

values.0: The register of filter bank 7 is in mask bit mode.
values.1: The register of filter bank 7 is in identifier list mode.

FBM7.comment: Only can be written when FINT is 1.

FBM8.name: Working mode control of filter bank 8

values.0: The register of filter bank 8 is in mask bit mode.
values.1: The register of filter bank 8 is in identifier list mode.

FBM8.comment: Only can be written when FINT is 1.

FBM9.name: Working mode control of filter bank 9

values.0: The register of filter bank 9 is in mask bit mode.
values.1: The register of filter bank 9 is in identifier list mode.

FBM9.comment: Only can be written when FINT is 1.

FBM10.name: Working mode control of filter bank 10

values.0: The register of filter bank 10 is in mask bit mode.
values.1: The register of filter bank 10 is in identifier list mode.

FBM10.comment: Only can be written when FINT is 1.

FBM11.name: Working mode control of filter bank 11

values.0: The register of filter bank 11 is in mask bit mode.
values.1: The register of filter bank 11 is in identifier list mode.

FBM11.comment: Only can be written when FINT is 1.

FBM12.name: Working mode control of filter bank 12

values.0: The register of filter bank 12 is in mask bit mode.
values.1: The register of filter bank 12 is in identifier list mode.

FBM12.comment: Only can be written when FINT is 1.

FBM13.name: Working mode control of filter bank 13

values.0: The register of filter bank 13 is in mask bit mode.
values.1: The register of filter bank 13 is in identifier list mode.

FBM13.comment: Only can be written when FINT is 1.

FSC0.name: Filter scale configuration bit of filter bank 0

values.1: The register of filter bank 0 is a single 32-bit.
values.0: The register of filter bank 0 is 2 16-bit.

FSC0.comment: Only can be written when FINT is 1.

FSC1.name: Filter scale configuration bit of filter bank 1

values.1: The register of filter bank 1 is a single 32-bit.
values.0: The register of filter bank 1 is 2 16-bit.

FSC1.comment: Only can be written when FINT is 1.

FSC2.name: Filter scale configuration bit of filter bank 2

values.1: The register of filter bank 2 is a single 32-bit.
values.0: The register of filter bank 2 is 2 16-bit.

FSC2.comment: Only can be written when FINT is 1.

FSC3.name: Filter scale configuration bit of filter bank 3

values.1: The register of filter bank 3 is a single 32-bit.
values.0: The register of filter bank 3 is 2 16-bit.

FSC3.comment: Only can be written when FINT is 1.

FSC4.name: Filter scale configuration bit of filter bank 4

values.1: The register of filter bank 4 is a single 32-bit.
values.0: The register of filter bank 4 is 2 16-bit.

FSC4.comment: Only can be written when FINT is 1.

FSC5.name: Filter scale configuration bit of filter bank 5

values.1: The register of filter bank 5 is a single 32-bit.
values.0: The register of filter bank 5 is 2 16-bit.

FSC5.comment: Only can be written when FINT is 1.

F0R1.name: CAN2 Filter Register 1 for Filter Bank 0

FB.name: Filter bits
FB.comment:
In identifier mode:
1: Expected level of the corresponding bit is a recessive bit;
0: Expected level of the corresponding bit is a dominant bit.

In mask bit mode:
1: Must be consistent with the corresponding identifier register bit;
0: No need to be consistent with the corresponding identifier register bit.

Only can be written when FINT is 1.

FB.name: Filter bits
FB.comment:
In identifier mode:
1: Expected level of the corresponding bit is a recessive bit;
0: Expected level of the corresponding bit is a dominant bit.

In mask bit mode:
1: Must be consistent with the corresponding identifier register bit;
0: No need to be consistent with the corresponding identifier register bit.

Only can be written when FINT is 1.
